alert.note: Alert for Anson; Hoke; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Moore, Scotland, southeastern Anson, southeastern Montgomery, Richmond and Hoke Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Rockingham to near Hamlet to near Wallace. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurinburg, Southern Pines, Rockingham, Raeford, Carthage, Pinehurst, Hamlet, Aberdeen, Maxton and Hoffman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Anson; Hoke; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond; Scotland
